snippet: On a low-protein diet, the body is forced to get its protein from lean body mass, a study shows.
abstract: Dr George A Bray study published in The Journal of the American Medical Association finds that people consuming excess calories on a low-protein diet may gain less weight than others, but they will also lose lean body mass.
lead_paragraph: On a low-protein diet, the body is forced to get its protein from lean body mass, a study shows.

headline.seo: Low-Protein Diets May Be Costly to Lean Body Mass
headline.main: Nutrition: Low-Protein Diet May Cost Lean Body Mass
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: Low-Protein Diet May Cost Lean Body Mass

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations
